thread.title: Austin Dillon wins Xfinity Series race at Charlotte
thread.title_full: Austin Dillon wins Xfinity Series race at Charlotte

title: Austin Dillon wins Xfinity Series race at Charlotte
text:
Austin Dillon has pre-race fireworks scare, completes Xfinity Series sweep at Charlotte By STEVE REED AP Sports Writer   10:25   10:25   
People: 
North Carolina (541) 

CONCORD, North Carolina â€” Austin Dillon dodged fireworks before the race and coasted to an Xfinity Series victory at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Friday night. 
Dillon led 61 laps and help off Erik Jones to complete a season sweep at the track. The Sprint Cup driver has four victories this season in the second-tier series. 
Dillon's night started with a scare when fireworks from a pre-race celebration landed near his back as he was leaning on his No. 33 Chevrolet after introductions. 
The pole sitter was startled when fireworks landed on his car, causing him to jump out of the way along with his girlfriend Whitney Ward. He let out a wide smile after realizing what had happened. 
His fire suit was slightly singed. 
Kyle Busch led 102 laps before his night ended when he hit the wall after Kasey Kahne tapped him from behind with 50 laps remaining. 
Series leader Chris Buescher finished seventh to maintain his points lead.
